name: NPR
text:
President Trump's campaign announced it has postponed its rally Saturday in Portsmouth, N.H., due to anticipated bad weather. (@nhpr)
https://t.co/st8JlhyXq7

name: NPR
text:
California will release up to 8,000 prisoners this summer in an effort to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. The news comes after more than a third of the inmates and staff at the San Quentin prison tested positive.
https://t.co/7w5XrR4XI4

name: NPR
text:
Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms ordered a return to Phase 1 restrictions amid a record-breaking spike in coronavirus cases. 

But Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp, quickly dismissed the mayor's directive, saying only he has that authority.
https://t.co/WMzSv6tRiv

name: NPR
text:
3 LA police officers face charges of falsifying records and obstruction of justice over allegations that they wrongly identified dozens of people as gang members, the city's district attorney's office says.
https://t.co/l7sPPcyESa

name: NPR
text:
The number of coronavirus cases is soaring in Texas, and the state is rolling back its reopening plans.

"What good is the economy if there's nobody around to spend money?" League City Mayor Pat Hallisey said in support of the safety measures.
https://t.co/Ml4yXGDNtA
